meanings.definition: A person who fails an exam or course.
meanings.sent1: The poor flunker felt disappointed after seeing his exam results.
meanings.sent2: The teacher offered extra help to the flunker to improve his grades.
meanings.sent3: The flunker joked that he must have studied with the wrong book.
meanings.sent4: Despite his efforts, he remained a flunker in the eyes of his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The label of 'flunker' stuck with him throughout the school year.

meanings.definition: To fail an exam or course.
meanings.sent1: I hope I don't flunker my math test tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She was determined not to flunker the important final exam.
meanings.sent3: He managed to flunker every test this semester, much to his surprise.
meanings.sent4: The thought of flunkering the exam made her nervous.
meanings.sent5: She studied hard to avoid flunkering the course.
